items.sentence: I\'m not a mind reader. You need to tell me what you want.
I\'ve spent way too much time thinking about this problem.
We\'re thinking of adding on another bedroom to the house.
When you\'ve finished reading that book, please return it.
Why didn\'t you tell me you were planning to go to Boston?
Why don\'t you both come out here and look for yourselves?
I thought Tom would plant those flowers near the oak tree.
Tom and Mary usually get home later than their parents do.
Tom and Mary walk to school together almost every morning.
Tom and Mary were having coffee together out on the porch.
Tom and Mary were sitting next to each other on the couch.
Tom carried Mary into the house and laid her on the couch.
Tom can take his time. Tell him there\'s no need to hurry.
Tom isn\'t the only one here who doesn\'t know what to do.
Tom pawned the pocket watch his grandfather had given him.
Tom picked up the baby and she immediately stopped crying.
Tom planted some explosives near the middle of the bridge.
Tom poured milk into the glass and then handed it to Mary.
I still haven\'t decided whether to go by car or by train.
Tom says that he doesn\'t want to go to Australia with me.
